intro: Sciodaphyllum mannii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are alternate and often have a distinctive waxy coating. Sciodaphyllum mannii is primarily valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal medicine.
